itemDescription: British film actor of the silent era

wikipedia_page.main: Gregory Scott was a British film actor of the silent era. He was born Gregory Scott Frances on 15 December 1879 in Sandy, Bedfordshire, England.

response: *Trent's Last Case directed by Richard Garrick; starring Gregory Scott, Pauline Peters and Clive Brook

Trent's Last Case is a 1920 British silent crime film directed by Richard Garrick and starring Gregory Scott, Pauline Peters and Clive Brook.BFI.org It is an adaptation of the 1913 novel Trent's Last Case by E. C. Bentley. Detective Philip Trent investigates the mysterious murder of the financier Sigsbee Manderson.
* Gregory Scott – Philip Trent
* Gregory Scott - Michael Ayde

Lawyer Quince is a 1914 British silent comedy film directed by Harold M. Shaw and starring Charles Rock, Lillian Logan and Gregory Scott. It was made by the London Film Company based on a short story by W. W. Jacobs.
* Gregory Scott - Ned Quince

A Great Coup is a 1919 British silent sports film directed by George Dewhurst and Walter West and starring Stewart Rome, Poppy Wyndham and Gregory Scott. It was based on a novel by Nat Gould.Low p.152 The film is about a racehorse owner who decides to race his best horse in a major race meeting after his jockey is nobbled by the opposition.
* Gregory Scott - Reid Gordon

The Little Minister is a 1915 British silent romance film directed by Percy Nash and starring Joan Ritz, Gregory Scott and Henry Vibart. It was based on an 1891 novel The Little Minister by J.M. Barrie which was subsequently turned into a play The Little Minister in 1897. It was one of five film adaptations of the story.
* Gregory Scott - Gavin Dishart
* Gregory Scott - Tom Roberts
* Gregory Scott - Frank Morland
* Gregory Scott - Charles

Beauty and the Barge is a 1914 British silent comedy film directed by Harold M. Shaw and starring Cyril Maude, Lillian Logan and Gregory Scott.BFI.org It is an adaptation of the 1905 play Beauty and the Barge by W. W. Jacobs. A sound version of the same story was released in 1937.
* Gregory Scott - Lieutenant Seton Boyne

The Case of Lady Camber is a 1920 British silent mystery film directed by Walter West and starring Violet Hopson, Stewart Rome and Gregory Scott. Lord Camber comes under suspicion of murdering his wife, an ex-chorus girl. It was adapted from a 1915 play of the same title by Horace Annesley Vachell. It was made at Walthamstow Studios.
* Gregory Scott as Lord Camber

A Dead Certainty is a 1920 British silent sports drama film directed by George Dewhurst and starring Gregory Scott, Poppy Wyndham and Cameron Carr.BFI.org It was based on a novel by Nathaniel Gould.Low p.152 A jockey comes under pressure from his girlfriend's relations to fix a horse race.
* Gregory Scott ...  Arthur Dunbar
* Gregory Scott

The Loudwater Mystery is a 1921 British silent crime film directed by Walter West and starring Gregory Scott, Pauline Peters and Clive Brook. It was based on the 1920 novel The Loudwater Mystery by Edgar Jepson.
* Gregory Scott as Hubert Manley
In 1921, the novel was made by Broadwest into a silent film directed by Walter West and starring Gregory Scott, Pauline Peters and Clive Brook.Goble p.245
* Gregory Scott as Richard Cardyne
Not Negotiable is a 1918 British silent crime film directed by Walter West and starring Julian Royce, Manora Thew and Gregory Scott.BFI.org
* Gregory Scott ...  Claude Saville
Greg or Gregory Scott may refer to:
* Gregory Scott (1879–?), British film actor
* Malcom Gregory Scott, (born 1962) American writer, activist, and AIDS survivor
A Sportsman's Wife is a 1921 British silent sports film directed by Walter West and starring Violet Hopson, Gregory Scott and Clive Brook.BFI.org
* Gregory Scott - Harry Kerr

Kissing Cup's Race is a 1920 British silent sports film directed by Walter West and starring Violet Hopson, Gregory Scott and Clive Brook.BFI.org It is based on the poem Kissing Cup's Race by Campbell Rae Brown.
* Gregory Scott - Lord Hilhoxton

Flying from Justice  is a 1915 British silent crime film directed by Percy Nash and starring Gregory Scott, Douglas Payne  and Joan Ritz.Palmer p.895
* Gregory Scott as Charles Baring
A Rogue's Wife is a 1915 British silent crime film directed by Percy Nash and starring Gregory Scott, Daisy Cordell and Joan Ritz.Palmer p.902
* Gregory Scott
The Green Orchard is a 1916 British silent drama film directed by Harold Weston and starring Gregory Scott, Dora Barton and Ernie Collins.Low p.287 It is based on a novel by Andrew Soutar.
* Gregory Scott as Martin Wilderspin

link_mentions.page: The Romance of a Movie Star
response: The Romance of a Movie Star is a 1920 British silent romance film directed by Richard Garrick and starring Violet Hopson, Stewart Rome and Gregory Scott.Low p.438 It is based on the novel The World's Best Girl by Coralie Stanton.
* Gregory Scott as Robert Arkwright
The Penniless Millionaire is a 1921 British silent drama film directed by Einar Bruun and starring Stewart Rome, Fabienne Fabrèges and Gregory Scott.Low p.427
* Gregory Scott as Belthorp

A Munition Girl's Romance is a 1917 British silent thriller film directed by Frank Wilson and starring Violet Hopson, Gregory Scott and George Foley.Palmer p.368 The screenplay concerns a young woman from a wealthy family who goes to work in a munitions factory during the First World War.
* Gregory Scott as George Brandon
The Gentleman Rider is a 1919 British silent sports drama film directed by Walter West and starring Violet Hopson, Stewart Rome and Gregory Scott.Palmer p.117
* Gregory Scott as Sir Reginald Buckley

She Stoops to Conquer is a 1914 British silent historical comedy film directed by George Loane Tucker and starring Henry Ainley,  Jane Gail and Gregory Scott. It is an adaptation of Oliver Goldsmith's play She Stoops to Conquer.Goble p.950
* Gregory Scott as Jeremy
A Rogue in Love is a 1922 British silent film directed by Albert Brouett and starring Frank Stanmore, Ann Trevor and Gregory Scott.Goble p.172
* Gregory Scott as Joe Bradwick
In the Ranks is a 1914 British silent drama film directed by Percy Nash and starring Gregory Scott, Daisy Cordell and James Lindsay.Goble p.430
* Gregory Scott as Ned / John Drayton
In Full Cry is a 1921 British silent drama film directed by Einar Bruun and starring Gregory Scott, Pauline Peters and Cecil Mannering.Low p.388
* Gregory Scott as Blaise Palhurston
The Green Caravan is a 1922 British silent drama film directed by Edwin J. Collins and starring Catherine Calvert, Gregory Scott and Valia.Low p.377
* Gregory Scott as Hugo Drummond
